results.title: Picking grapes
results.creator_credit: Jack Keane and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: Shot close to the Murry river. Predominantly features instructional sequences on how to pick and process grapes. Nice shots featuring contrasting Orange and Green colours in the soil/grapes. Four soundtracks accompany picture; Italian, German, English and Hungarian.

results.title: Pick up your feet: the double dutch show
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A powerful examination of the determined spirits who compete in the Double Dutch rope-jumping championships in New York City. In this raw work, both the camera and the microphone have the incidental presence of a trusted insider. Moving between the training and the competition, Blumberg manages to capture the excitement of the crowd, as young athletes drive themselves and their partners to the edge of the possible. The rhythmic beat of the ropes, the chants, and the strain of concentration, taps into an unexpected well of emotion through which we seem to be almost participants in the event itself.

results.title: Piccolo, saxo and company
results.creator_credit: Philips and Company, Joop Geesink's Dollywood Productions and Jan Coolen
results.brief_description: How the symphony orchestra was born. The string family of musical instruments met the brass family, and the woodwind family. They were joined by the family of drums and percussion, and eventually the Grand Piano completed the orchestra.

results.title: Picasso: war, peace & love
results.brief_description: From his epic “Guernica” to some of his last works. This film spans some thirty years of Picasso’s art. It includes many unfamiliar works as well as some unique live sequences of the artist in his studio near Cannes. NOTE: Film content is worthy of viewing but print condition is poor with excessive colour fade (pinkish-red tones).

results.title: Picasso: the man and his work
results.brief_description: This unique film, shot when Picasso was 91, (the last pictures taken in his lifetime) reveals many unknown aspects of the work and personality of the greatest painter of our time, and contains over 600 of his works, many never seen in public. Using intimate and exclusive home movies and photos, the film shows Picasso as if he were going through the scrapbook of his life. With many flashback sequences showing the mutations and evolution of his work in progress, we chronologically follow his works and the episodes of his life in parallel. The film is in two parts: 1881-1937 and 1938-1973.

results.title: Picasso: a painter's diary
results.creator_credit: WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.), Thirteen and Perry Miller Adato
results.brief_description: Presents an overview of the life of Pablo Picasso, the main theme being that Picasso’s painting were his autobiography. Features photographs, documentary footage and interviews with friends and family of Picasso. Many of Picasso’s works are highlighted. Contains some B&W scenes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Picasso the sculptor
results.creator_credit: Arts Council of Great Britain and Roland Penrose
results.brief_description: Surveys the sculpture of Picasso from the early figurative heads of 1902-l903; the cubist constructions of 1912-l924; his carved and modelled figures of the 1930’s; his bronze assemblages and ceramic sculptures of the 1940’s and the 1950’s, to the sheet metal cut-outs of the sixties.

results.title: Picasso Peintre du Siecle = Picasso Artist of the Century
results.brief_description:
Profile of one of the most influential artist of the 20th century. Highlights includes the genesis of the famous painting ‘Guernica’.

Credits: Producer, Simon Schiffrin ; director, Lauro Venturi ; writer, Jean Leymarie ; photography, Jean Bourgoin ; music, Roman Vlad.
Cast: Alain Mottet [narration only].
